Popular mentions

DL2Some wrote a review Jan 2020

Detroit Lakes, Minnesota838 contributions259 helpful votes

Grandiose

The size is astonishing and the interior is beautiful. Access is divided by gender, men and women have separate entrances. Women are outfitted with a special cloak to conform to the modesty rules of The Republic. Once inside the genders are kept on their respective sides by…

Read more

Date of experience: November 2019

Ömer Yalçınkaya wrote a review Oct 2019

Montreal, Canada770 contributions84 helpful votes

Great architecture and beautiful complex

It is the tomb of Ayatollah Khomeini. But it looks more like a mosque than a mausoleum. In the evening the lightening makes it even more attractive.

Read more

Date of experience: September 2019

The Mausoleum of Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini.

The Mausoleum of Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini Also referred to as the holy shrine of Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini, his wife Khadijeh Saqafi, and his second son Ahmad Khomeini; and some political figures, such as former President Akbar Hashemi Rafsanjani. The complex spreads over…

Singapore, Singapore16 contributions5 helpful votes

Neat architectural

We were in awe of the chandeliers and lights in this location. It is kept clean and you can see others worshiping this Imam.

Ben Here Done That wrote a review Nov 2018

75 contributions43 helpful votes

Okay for Enroute Airport Stop -- Don't Make a Trip

By the standards of the mosques that Iran has to offer, this was pretty average and didn't really do much for me. Plus, it is pretty new so nothing to really appreciate. I stopped by it on my way from the airport... wouldn't make the hike otherwise.
